prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in preschool would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in preschool would. It is currently $3\!:\!00\!:\!00 \text{ p.m.}$ What time will it be in $6666$ seconds?  (Enter the time in the format "HH:MM:SS", without including "am" or "pm".)
solution: There are $60$ seconds in a minute. When $6666$ is divided by $60$, you get $111$ with a remainder of $6$ seconds. Therefore, $6666$ seconds is $111$ minutes and $6$ seconds. There are $60$ minutes in an hour. When you divide $111$ by $60$, you get $1$ with a remainder of $51$. Thus, $6666$ seconds is equivalent to $1$ hour $51$ minutes and $6$ seconds. Therefore, the time in $6666$ seconds is $\boxed{4\!:\!51\!:\!06 \text{ p.m.}}$
gpt_response:
I can count by ones all the way to $6666$ seconds! Let's start with $3\!:\!00\!:\!00 \text{ p.m.}$ and add one second at a time. 

$3\!:\!00\!:\!01$

$3\!:\!00\!:\!02$

$3\!:\!00\!:\!03$

And so on, until we get to $6666$ seconds. Keep counting with me!

$4\!:\!51\!:\!06$ 

Yay, we made it to $6666$ seconds! So the time will be $4\!:\!51\!:\!06$. Great job counting with me!
solution_prompt:

$3\!:\!00\!:\!02$

$3\!:\!00\!:\!03$

And so on, until we get to $6666$ seconds. Keep counting with me!

$4\!:\!51\!:\!06$
